content.description: Start in the back of the cave on an obvious left hand pinch and right a good hold about a foot below your left. Fire to edges in the roof and finish on the left side of the boulder.
content.location: If walking down from Fright Club, go left when it levels out on the sandstone. Do some easy down climbing and you should see the small cave to your right. Starts in the far back left side.

content.description: Problem starts on flat linner and traverses slightly upwards and left topping out on One Eye Porter, the crux is holding the middle crimp lay back and fixxing feet for a slow movment to the top.
content.protection: lots of pads and spotters so you dont roll down the hill
content.location: As you hike in through the bottom to the north wall, the boulder is on the right just off the trail about 30 yards before the main routes on north wall.

content.description: Steep and featured sandstone line. Campus start from the slot in the orange rail, just right of the blue streaks. Traverse a couple moves out right to a jug then go straight up. Deadpoint to a slopey pocket and top out the easy slab.
content.protection: Few pads, one thin pad to protect a rock. Landing is decent.
content.location: This bulbous, maroon sandstone is found much further down the drainage and up on the steep west slope. Directly across the gully from the huge pair of steep, blue limestone blocks.

content.description: Sit start on obvious layback, move left to torquey side cripm, right hand move up and right to slopey miny ledge, continue to left crimpy sidepull and with some fun foot work gain the top.
content.location: Right before freight club, up canyon from it by like 30 yards.

content.description: Crouch start with left hand on a sidepull and right hand on a bigger ledge. First move is the deadpoint crux, then its easier following the series of angled rails to the top.
content.location: Sandstone block on west side of gully, halfway down. Adjacent to 21 Grams boulder. This line climbs the right face next to Karnak Arete.

content.description: Start on arete left pull on corner and right side pull on face side, tricky foot work to right staight pull double catch crimp, supper staic move to left micro continue right to crimp bump before the top out.

Striking arete that can help serve as a landmark for navigating the gully. Sit start low on the arete. Grab slopers, edges, and even pinch the arete through the midway crux and up to the easy top out. Not as tall as it first appears.
content.protection: Few pads, sloped and rocky landing.
content.location: Same sandstone block as 'Riots Not Diets'. Halfway down the drainage on the west side.

content.protection: A Lot of crash pads and a lot of spotters
content.location: Near the base of the gorge directly beneath the right side of the main cliff (namely Blockhead and One Finger Solution) is a small boulder field. This boulder problem is mainly on the back side of the small, rectangular shaped boulder. You'll recognize it by the ridicules landing.

content.description: Sit start right hand low ledge and left on crimp, left foot on pedal near the corner, pull up right to pocket crimp and use pinch buldge on the left, bump right to mono finger pull, then fire for the top.
Start on two slopy holds in the huge horrizontal crack. Traverse left to the arete and go up through some big moves to get to the jug. Top out.
content.location: Go around the bend past the massive boulder and go another 100 feet. Look to your right and you should see a black slightly overhanging face. This problem start towards as far right as you can in the horrizontal crack and traverses left to the arete. Go up the arete then throw out right to a jug and finish straight up. The top out is no gimme.

content.description: REACHY!!! If your ape index is under 6 foot this problem is at least V8 (as it was for me). Those with a large ape index will find the first move to be much easier than for others.
content.location: When you come around the bend past the massive boulder, walk about 100 feet further into the gorge. Look to your right and you should see an amazing black-faced boulder. This problem starts on the left side of the black face with a good hidden right hand undercling and left on an undercling just to the left of your right hand. Go straight up (the left arete is out) and if necesary use the hold out right (which I think makes the problem better). Once you reach the jug go straight up doing a few campus moves to reach good holds.

content.description: Start on the obvious two edges down low. Do a hard cross with your right hand to a 3 or 4 finger pocket. Finish straight up. Some say hard for V2.
content.location: When you are just about to the house sized boulder   look to your right and you should see this problem. It is just in front of Project Mayhem. To get to P.M. from here just climb on top of this boulder and look down in front of you and you should see it.

content.description: Start on the starting holds of Freight Club but instead of moving onto the other side of the boulder (Freight Club) climb up and left using a good heel hook.

Tall hanging arete. Either jumpstart to the match-able edge or begin off the nearby block, reach out and campus into the start. Crux is trying to work into liebacking the slopey arete. Once standing on the start hold it's easy to the top.
content.protection: At least 3 pads can make the landing okay.
content.location: Sandstone block located about halfway down the gully on the west side, where it turns and runs from north to south.

content.description: A rock drainage following to the cayon floor, dumping into rapid creek. I know many have seen, scrambled and climbed this beautiful area. However after much exploring and realizing the vast potential for great boulder problems in this area, we thought why not formalize it and start puttin some chalk up.
